text: (upbeat music)

- Curative offers COVID testing
to lots of different people.
From the beginning,
we had an obsession with turnaround time,

between the point you log
onto your computer and say,

"How do I get a COVID
test?" to get the result,
that's something we obsess around.
For most labs, outside of the pandemic,
that's two, three, four days.

And I think a lot of attention's
being put on the pandemic,
to say, "Well, why?"
If I think I've got an infectious disease,
I need to know as soon as possible.
That obsession from the pandemic

carries learnings that we
can take beyond the pandemic.
We actually had to build our own software
for patients to make appointments,

a software that operates
our collection sites,

and the software that
runs our diagnostics labs.

Off-the-shelf solutions
were either too clunky
or just wouldn't scale.
Amazon's Textract is an example

of a tool that was
immediately available to us.

We could scale, we could
get great throughput,

great latency on it, and
it was HIPAA-compliant.
And that off-the-shelf tooling

is an essential part of
scaling up and building

an entire healthcare company
and system in a pandemic.
Curative's success has really shown
that there's this space in healthcare
for a new approach to delivering services,

and maybe thinking about
how to get those to patients

in ways that are
convenient and accessible,

building services that are
very accessible digitally,

but also can be used by
people who don't wanna touch
a laptop or a tablet or a phone at all.
